Path

Paths describe the visual connections between nodes in the maze.  They are described using a spec which contains a mixture of absolute and relative position information.  In addition, a colorfunction controls the color of the path.

Summary

computeLengththe length of the path in units.
interpreturns the linear position on the path parameterized by t from 0 to 1.

param,
cf)

delta

delta: function(i)

Returns the delta between path point i and i+1.

computeLength

computeLength: function()

the length of the path in units.

interp

interp: function(t)

returns the linear position on the path parameterized by t from 0 to 1.

step

step: function(point,
lastpos)

Used for construction the path.  Computes a possibly relative position.

count?[news] | absoluteposition
e.g., w or 4n or CN3

translate

translate: function(point)

Computes an absolute position in a path spec.

[ABC]?[NEWS][1-4]
e.g., N3 or AW1

Node

Nodes connect paths in the maze.  They have a cosmetic x and y and topological north/south/east/west actions which represent transitions from the node.

Maze

Creates a canvas object and makes it into a recursive maze.  The maze contains three copies of itself, originally named A, B, and C (clockwise from top left).  Despite its small size, solving this maze seems to require going at least 4 descents deep into the copies.

The maze object has a lot of state

There are the paths and map of nodes that define the maze, and then there’s a traversing stack/graph and current node, a camera status, a player position among other things.

Drawing is done using two intervals, a draw update thread and a drawing thread which ‘asynchonously’ pulls the last draw action and executes it.

Summary
Functions
getNodeUtility routine that gets the node at a given location in the grid
resetresets the maze to the initial state
definePathsInitializes the maze structure.

exitNode action for exiting a subcopy of the maze.
traverseNode action for moving along a path in the maze
autoThis function causes the player to automatically progress at nodes which have only 2 alternatives.

Functions

getNode

getNode: function(at)

Utility routine that gets the node at a given location in the grid

reset

reset: function()

resets the maze to the initial state

definePaths

definePaths: function()

Initializes the maze structure.  First it parses all the paths, then it sets up all the enter and exit nodes, then it hooks up the paths to all the nodes (generating interior nodes as necessary).

offset

offset: function(box)

utility routine that gets the offset of an inner maze.  A is the upper left, then B on the upper right, and C on the lower left.

enter

enter: function(box,
node,
dir)

Node action for entering a subcopy of the maze.  Updates the traversing graph

exit

exit: function(loc,
dir)

Node action for exiting a subcopy of the maze.  Moves up on the traversing graph

traverse

traverse: function(path,
dir,
reverse,
done)

Node action for moving along a path in the maze

auto

auto: function(dir)

This function causes the player to automatically progress at nodes which have only 2 alternatives.

go

go: function(f)

Used to invoke node actions, and store them for the replay feature which occurs when the maze is completed.

drawTraversedPaths

drawTraversedPaths: function(ctx,
traversing)

Draws used paths in the maze.  Used paths are drawn at a deeper level than the rest.

drawMaze

drawMaze: function(ctx,
traversing)

Just draws the maze inside the outer rect.  Used to draw subcopies so that navigation is easier.

draw

draw: function(traversing)

Draws the maze, subcopies and the probable supercopy.
